page.title: 14SWAYTHLING HOUSING SOCIETY
page.content: After WW1 there was a{housing}shortage and in 1925 the Swaythling Housing Society was formed in an attempt to rectify the situation. The houses were designed by Herbert Collins, a well known architect in{local history}with style and layout being influenced by the work done at Welwyn Garden City. The estate has attractive colour washed houses set around open greens with archways linking areas. New roads and buildings are named after former chairmen of the Society. The Society shows{social concern}in catering for the needs of every age group when planning{housing}from 1 bedroom flats to 4 bedroom houses. Recent building has been for the elderly in warden assisted flats. Most of the{housing}is still in the original area of {Mansbridge.}The society owns maintains and lets around 1100 properties.
